sen.j: 前島 密（まえじま ひそか、天保6年1月7日 (旧暦)（1835年2月4日） - 大正8年（1919年）4月27日）は、日本の官僚、政治家。
sen.e: Hisoka MAEJIMA (February 4, 1835-April 27, 1919) was a Japanese government official as well as a statesman.
Hisoka MAEJIMA (February 4, 1835-April 27, 1919) was a Japanese government official as well as a statesman.
Hisoka MAEJIMA (February 4, 1835-April 27, 1919) was a Japanese government official as well as a statesman.

sen.j: 日本の近代郵便制度の創設者の一人で1円切手の肖像で知られる。
sen.e: He was one of the founders of modern postal system in Japan and has been known for the portrait on one-yen stamp.
He was one of the founders of modern postal system in Japan and has been known for the portrait on one-yen stamp.
He was one of the founders of modern postal system in Japan and has been known for the portrait on one-yen stamp.

sen.j: 「郵便」や「切手」、「ハガキ」という名称を定めた。
sen.e: He gave names of "Yubin (for postal service)", "Kitte (for a stamp)", and "Hagaki (for a postal card)".
He gave names of "Yubin (for postal service)", "Kitte (for a stamp)", and "Hagaki (for a postal card)."
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: He gave names of "Yubin (for postal service)", "Kitte (for a stamp)", and "Hagaki (for a postal card)."

sen.j: その功績から「郵便制度の父」と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Based on his achievements, he has been called as "the father of postal system".
Based on his achievements, he has been called as "the father of postal system."
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: Based on his achievements, he has been called as "the father of postal system."

sen.j: 大久保利通らが当初進めていた大阪遷都に対し江戸遷都を建白した事でも知られる。
sen.e: He has also been known to have made a petition for Edo-sento (Transferring of the national capital to Edo) as against Osaka-sento (Transferring of the national capital to Osaka) forwarded at first by Toshimichi OKUBO and others.

He has also been known to have made a petition for Edo-sento (Transferring of the national capital to Edo) as against Osaka-sento (Transferring of the national capital to Osaka) forwarded at first by Toshimichi OKUBO and others.

He has also been known to have made a petition for Edo-sento (Transferring of the national capital to Edo) as against Osaka-sento (Transferring of the national capital to Osaka) forwarded at first by Toshimichi OKUBO and others.

sen.j: 国字改良論者。
sen.e: He was the reformer of Japan's official script.
He was the reformer of Japan's official script.
He was the reformer of Japan's official script.

sen.j: - 越後国頸城郡津有村下池部（現在の新潟県上越市）に豪農、上野助右衛門の二男としてうまれる。
sen.e: He was born as the second son of Sukeemon UENO, a wealthy farmer in Shimoikebe, Tsuari-mura, Kubiki-gun, Echigo Province (Joetsu City, Niigata Prefecture at present).
He was born as the second son of Sukeemon UENO, a wealthy farmer in Shimoikebe, Tsuari-mura, Kubiki-gun, Echigo Province (Joetsu City, Niigata Prefecture at present).
He was born as the second son of Sukeemon UENO, a wealthy farmer in Shimoikebe, Tsuari-mura, Kubiki-gun, Echigo Province (Joetsu City, Niigata Prefecture at present).

sen.j: 房五郎と名づけられる。
sen.e: He had been named as Fusagoro.
He was named as Fusagoro.
He was named as Fusagoro.

sen.j: - 江戸に出て医学を修め、蘭学・英語を学ぶ。
sen.e: He came to Edo to master medicine and learned Rangaku (western studies) and English.
He came to Edo to master medicine and learned Rangaku (western studies) and English.
He came to Edo to master medicine and learned Rangaku (western studies) and English.

sen.j: - 航海術を学ぶため函館市へ赴く。
sen.e: He went to Hakodate City to learn seamanship.
He went to Hakodate City to learn seamanship.
He went to Hakodate City to learn seamanship.

sen.j: 名を巻退蔵と改める。
sen.e: He changed his name to Taizo MAKI.
He changed his name to Taizo MAKI.
He changed his name to Taizo MAKI.

sen.j: - 武田斐三郎の諸術調所に入る。
sen.e: He entered shojutsushirabesho (an educational institution for western studies and military science) of Ayasaburo TAKEDA.
He entered shojutsushirabesho (an educational institution for western studies and military science) of Ayasaburo TAKEDA.
He entered shojutsushirabesho (an educational institution for western studies and military science) of Ayasaburo TAKEDA.

sen.j: - 薩摩藩の洋学校（開成所）の蘭学講師となる。
sen.e: He became a Rangaku teacher of yogakko (Kaiseijo) (school of western studies) in Satsuma Domain.
He became a Rangaku teacher of yogakko (Kaiseijo) (school of western studies) in Satsuma Domain.
He became a Rangaku teacher of yogakko (Kaiseijo) (school of western studies) in Satsuma Domain.

sen.j: - 幕臣前島家の養子となり、家督を継いで前島来輔と名乗る。
sen.e: He was adopted by Maejima family, a Shogun's retainer, took over as head of the family, and designated himself as Raisuke MAEJIMA.
He was adopted by Maejima family, a Shogun's retainer, took over as head of the family, and designated himself as Raisuke MAEJIMA.
He was adopted by Maejima family, a Shogun's retainer, took over as head of the family, and designated himself as Raisuke MAEJIMA.

sen.j: 漢字御廃止之議を征夷大将軍徳川慶喜に提出。
sen.e: He submitted a proposal to abolish the use of kanji (Chinese characters) to Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, the Seitaishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians, great, unifying leader).

He submitted a proposal to abolish the use of kanji (Chinese characters) to Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, the Seitaishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians, great, unifying leader).

He submitted a proposal to abolish the use of kanji (Chinese characters) to Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, the Seitaishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians, great, unifying leader).

sen.j: - 明治政府の招聘により、民部省・大蔵省に出仕。
sen.e: Invited by Meiji Government, he began to serve in Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs) and Okura-sho (Ministry of the Treasury).
Invited by Meiji Government, he began to serve in Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs) and Okura-sho (Ministry of the Treasury).
Invited by Meiji Government, he began to serve in Minbusho (Ministry of Popular Affairs) and Okura-sho (Ministry of the Treasury).

sen.j: - 租税権正、5月には駅逓権正兼任となり、太政官に郵便制度創設を建議。
sen.e: He became sozei gonnokami, then in May, ekitei gonnnokami (the principle officer of posts) concurrently, and proposed Daijokan (Grand Council of State) to establish a postal system.

He became sozei gonnokami (the principle officer of tax), then in May, ekitei gonnnokami (the principle officer of posts) concurrently, and proposed Daijokan (Grand Council of State) to establish a postal system.
sen.cmt: 「租税権正」に説明を追加しました。
sen.e: He became sozei gonnokami (the principle officer of tax), then in May, ekitei gonnnokami (the principle officer of posts) concurrently, and proposed Daijokan (Grand Council of State) to establish a postal system.

sen.j: 郵便制度視察および鉄道建設借款契約締結のため渡英。
sen.e: He went to Great Britain to inspect postal system and conclude a contract to loan money for railway construction.
He went to Great Britain to inspect the postal system and conclude a contract to loan money for railway construction.
He went to Great Britain to inspect the postal system and conclude a contract to loan money for railway construction.

tit.cmt: コンマを削除しました。

sen.j: - 帰国、駅逓頭に任じられ、郵便制度創設に尽力、日本の近代的郵便制度の基礎を確立。
sen.e: On coming back to Japan, he was appointed as Ekitei-no-kami (Minister of Post and Telecommunications), exerted himself to found postal system, and established basis of modern postal system in Japan.

On coming back to Japan, he was appointed as Ekitei-no-kami (Minister of Post and Telecommunications), exerted himself to found a postal system, and established the basis of a modern postal system in Japan.

On coming back to Japan, he was appointed as Ekitei-no-kami (Minister of Post and Telecommunications), exerted himself to found a postal system, and established the basis of a modern postal system in Japan.

sen.j: - 陸海元会社（現、日本通運）、報知新聞（現・スポーツ報知）の設立及び刊行に関与。
sen.e: He participated in the establishment of Rikuun-Motogaisha (a land transportation company) (Nippon Express Co., Ltd. at present) and publication of Hochi Shinbun (newspaper) (Sports Hochi at present).
sen.cmt: 「陸海元会社」は、http://www.nittsu.co.jp/about/j-2.htmlより、「陸運元会社」の誤りのようです→「Rikuun-Motogaisha （a land transportation company)」としました。
sen.e: He participated in the establishment of Rikuun-Motogaisha (a land transportation company) (Nippon Express Co., Ltd. at present) and publication of Hochi Shinbun (newspaper) (Sports Hochi at present).
He participated in the establishment of Rikuun-Motogaisha (a land transportation company) (Nippon Express Co., Ltd. at present) and publication of Hochi Shinbun (newspaper) (Sports Hochi at present).

sen.j: - 駅逓局長に任命。
sen.e: He was appointed as the chief of Ekitei Kyoku (Postal Bureau).
He was appointed as the chief of Ekitei Kyoku (Postal Bureau).
He was appointed as the chief of Ekitei Kyoku (Postal Bureau).

sen.j: 第1回内国勧業博覧会審査官長。
sen.e: The chief examiner of the first National Industrial Exhibition.
He was also the chief examiner of the first National Industrial Exhibition.
sen.cmt: 主語と述語を追加しました。
sen.e: He was also the chief examiner of the first National Industrial Exhibition.

sen.j: - 元老院議官を兼任。
sen.e: He held an additional post of Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Elders).
He held an additional post of Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Elders).
He held an additional post of Genroin gikan (councilor of Chamber of Elders).

sen.j: - 内務省 (日本)駅逓総監に任じられる。
sen.e: He was appointed as the ekitei (postal) superintendent general of Ministry of Interior in Japan.
He was appointed as the ekitei (postal) superintendent general of Ministry of Interior in Japan.
He was appointed as the ekitei (postal) superintendent general of Ministry of Interior in Japan.

sen.j: - 「明治14年の政変」で辞職し、大隈重信らとともに立憲改進党を創立。
sen.e: He resigned on "1881 Political Crisis" and established the Constitutional Progressive Party together with Shigenobu OKUMA.
He resigned on "1881 Political Crisis" and established the Constitutional Progressive Party together with Shigenobu OKUMA.
He resigned on "1881 Political Crisis" and established the Constitutional Progressive Party together with Shigenobu OKUMA.

sen.j: - 東京専門学校（現早稲田大学）校長に就任、また関西鉄道会社社長。
sen.e: He became the president of Tokyo Senmon Gakko (Waseda University at present) and the president of Kansai Railroad Company.
He became the president of Tokyo Senmon Gakko (Waseda University at present) and the president of Kansai Railroad Company.
He became the president of Tokyo Senmon Gakko (Waseda University at present) and the president of Kansai Railroad Company.

sen.j: - 11月請われて逓信次官に、明治24年（1891年）3月まで在職した。
sen.e: He was asked to become the Vice Minister of Communications in November and hold office until March in 1891.
He was asked to become the Vice Minister of Communications in November and hold the office until March in 1891.
He was asked to become the Vice Minister of Communications in November and hold the office until March in 1891.

sen.j: 官営電話交換制度を実施。
sen.e: He inaugurated government-controlled telephone exchange system.
He inaugurated government-controlled telephone exchange system.
He inaugurated government-controlled telephone exchange system.

sen.j: - 北越鉄道株式会社の社長に就任、北越鉄道（直江津駅 - 新潟駅）建設を開始。
sen.e: He became the president of Railroad Co. Hokuetsu and started to construct Hokuetsu Railway (from Naoetsu Station to Nigata Station).
He became the president of Railroad Co. Hokuetsu and started to construct Hokuetsu Railway (from Naoetsu Station to Nigata Station).
He became the president of Railroad Co. Hokuetsu and started to construct Hokuetsu Railway (from Naoetsu Station to Nigata Station).

sen.j: - 男爵授与。
sen.e: He was granted Baron.
He was granted Baron.
He was granted Baron.

sen.j: - 貴族院 (日本)国会議員に選任。
sen.e: He was elected as a member of the House of Peers.
He was elected as a member of the House of Peers.
He was elected as a member of the House of Peers.

sen.j: - 神奈川県三浦郡西浦村芦名（現在の横須賀市芦名）の別荘如々山荘にて没。
sen.e: He was dead at 如々山荘, a villa in Ashina, Nishiura-mura, Miura-gun County, Kanagawa Prefecture (at present Ashina, Yokosuka City).
He died at Jojo sanso, a villa in Ashina, Nishiura-mura, Miura-gun County, Kanagawa Prefecture (at present Ashina, Yokosuka City).
sen.cmt: 読みは「じょじょ」のようです。参照：http://www.cocoyoko.net/history/h100000071.html表現を変更しました。
sen.e: He died at Jojo sanso, a villa in Ashina, Nishiura-mura, Miura-gun County, Kanagawa Prefecture (at present Ashina, Yokosuka City).
